column7: User input is passed to a function that executes a shell command. This can lead to remote code execution.
column11: CWE-78: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')
column12: {"fingerprints": {"matchBasedId/v1": "requires login"}, "locations": [{"physicalLocation": {"artifactLocation": {"uri": "/home/vboxuser/Diplomas/dvwa-src/vulnerabilities/api/src/HealthController.php", "uriBaseId": "%SRCROOT%"}, "region": {"endColumn": 52, "endLine": 88, "snippet": {"text": "\t\t\texec (\"ping -c 4 \" . $target, $output, $ret_var);"}, "startColumn": 4, "startLine": 88}}}], "message": {"text": "User input is passed to a function that executes a shell command. This can lead to remote code execution."}, "properties": {}, "ruleId": "php.lang.security.injection.tainted-exec.tainted-exec"}

column7: User data flows into this manually-constructed SQL string. User data can be safely inserted into SQL strings using prepared statements or an object-relational mapper (ORM). Manually-constructed SQL strings is a possible indicator of SQL injection, which could let an attacker steal or manipulate data from the database. Instead, use prepared statements (`$mysqli->prepare("INSERT INTO test(id, label) VALUES (?, ?)");`) or a safe library.
column11: CWE-89: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
column12: {"fingerprints": {"matchBasedId/v1": "requires login"}, "locations": [{"physicalLocation": {"artifactLocation": {"uri": "/home/vboxuser/Diplomas/dvwa-src/vulnerabilities/brute/source/low.php", "uriBaseId": "%SRCROOT%"}, "region": {"endColumn": 80, "endLine": 12, "snippet": {"text": "\t$query  = \"SELECT * FROM `users` WHERE user = '$user' AND password = '$pass';\";"}, "startColumn": 12, "startLine": 12}}}], "message": {"text": "User data flows into this manually-constructed SQL string. User data can be safely inserted into SQL strings using prepared statements or an object-relational mapper (ORM). Manually-constructed SQL strings is a possible indicator of SQL injection, which could let an attacker steal or manipulate data from the database. Instead, use prepared statements (`$mysqli->prepare(\"INSERT INTO test(id, label) VALUES (?, ?)\");`) or a safe library."}, "properties": {}, "ruleId": "php.lang.security.injection.tainted-sql-string.tainted-sql-string"}

column7: `Echo`ing user input risks cross-site scripting vulnerability. You should use `htmlentities()` when showing data to users.
column11: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
